intro: Cacalia laxa, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are usually blue or violet in color. Cacalia laxa is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in coastal and inland regions with well-drained soil.
